description:
Google accountants are a savvy bunch who handle the core accounting responsibilities at Google. As a member of this team, you know your accounting principles and the full accounting process end to end. You'll advise on financial reports required by governmental regulations, and you'll review, analyze, and interpret financial and budgetary reports -- and all this sounds like fun to you. Every day is a new challenge, and you're continually looking for ways to help our team get better at what we do, in the most efficient way possible. A team player at heart, you collaborate with our global team, advocate best practices and roll up your sleeves to pitch in when it's all hands on deck. You move fast while keeping your attention to detail, and you tap into your problem-solving skills to support Google's business objectives.

The Revenue Accounting team is responsible for the accounting, partner payments and operations for YouTube’s business growth opportunities and content.

The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance or Accounting or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in accounting, finance or business.
  • Experience in revenue accounting.

Preferred qualifications:

  • CPA or equivalent certification.
  • Experience in SQL.
  • Experience in managing process improvement.
  • Working knowledge of U.S. GAAP, with a focus on revenue recognition.
  • Ability to analyze, understand and present findings from large and complex datasets in order to drive business decisions.
  • Excellent business acumen, communication, presentation and project management skills. Ability to deal with ambiguity.
responsibilities:
• Perform month-end close processes, including contract review, processing payments, preparing/posting journal entries and reviewing account reconciliations. Prepare and present financials to management, as well as support with any ad hoc requests from cross-functional teams.
  • Provide accounting guidance to Sales, Product and other cross-functional teams on new products, features and agreements, including the performance of user acceptance testing (UAT).
  • Identify opportunities and implement programs to eliminate, automate or outsource activities. Work with the SOX team and cross-functional stakeholders to ensure that commerce products are on track.
  • Work with providers to outsource established or mature processes and manage ongoing activities. Collaborate with external audit staff for quarterly reviews, year-end audit procedures and statutory or partner audits.
  • Partner with internal teams and engineering and business partners to define, establish and implement accounting systems, processes and procedures.
title: Revenue Accountant, YouTube
